description:
A protein powder supply chain consists of Contract Manufacturer, Warehouse and Distributor. The flow is Contract Manufacturer to Warehouse to Distributor. Warehouses are at locations - Bhiwandi, Bangalore and Delhi. The Distributors are located at Agra, Ludhiana, Hyderabad, Indore, Jaipur, Surat, Vadodara and Tirunelveli. The Manufactures who have applied to be selected as Contract Manufacturers are at locations - Ahemdabad, Chennai, Kolkata, Pune and Bhopal. Only 2 manufactures would be selected from these. Optimise the supply chain network and select the two best manufacturers that would minimise the transportation cost. It should also tell which manufacturer is supplying to which warehouse and which warehouse is supplying to which distributor. The latitude and longitude of each location would be given. The cost of transportation per km is Rs. 6. The latitude and longitude are specified below.
Bhiwandi-19.333111,73.111504
Bengaluru-12.976750,77.575279
Delhi-28.704060,77.102493
Kolkata-22.565571,88.370209
Surat-21.203510,72.839233
Pune-18.520760,73.855408
Jaipur-26.920980,75.794220
Bhopal-23.252319,77.431091
Agra-27.167641,78.035873
Ludhiana-30.913170,75.849541
Hyderabad-17.361719,78.475166
Indore-22.718670,75.855713
Varodara-22.420550,73.165690
Tirunelveli-8.7150,77.7656
Ahemdabad-23.0225,72.5714
Chennai-13.0843,80.2705
problem_info: A protein powder supply chain network.
input_format: A set of parameters, including the latitude and longitude of each location, the transportation cost per km, and the number of CMs, Warehouses, and Distributors. Also included are a set of variables, including binary variables indicating whether a CM is selected, a CM is assigned to a Warehouse, and a Warehouse is assigned to a Distributor.
output_info: Selected Contract Manufacturers, allocation of Manufacturers to Warehouses, and allocation of Warehouses to Distributors.
output_format: A solution that includes the selection of two CMs, the assignment of each CM to a Warehouse, and the assignment of each Warehouse to one or two Distributors. The solution also includes the total transportation cost.

variables.definition: Is Manufacturer i assigned to Warehouse j?
Is Warehouse j assigned to Distributor k?

background: This problem deals with a protein powder supply chain consisting of a Contract Manufacturer (CM), a Warehouse and a Distributor. The objective is to select two CMs that minimize the total transportation cost, while ensuring that all required demands are met at the distributor level. This problem involves calculating the distance between locations using their latitude and longitude coordinates, and using the transportation cost per km to compute the overall transportation cost.

constraints.description: Each Contract Manufacturer i can be selected or not selected.
constraints.reasoning: This constraint ensures that each Contract Manufacturer i can be assigned to at most one Warehouse j.
constraints.relevant_section: The flow is Contract Manufacturer to Warehouse to Distributor.

constraints.description: Each Warehouse j can be assigned to at least one and at most two Distributors k.
constraints.reasoning: This constraint ensures that each Warehouse j can be assigned to at least one Distributor k.
constraints.relevant_section: The flow is Contract Manufacturer to Warehouse to Distributor.
